text: 'Cangjie programming language_function_overload_function_overloading_inheritance': 'In Cangjie code language, If a subclass defines a function with the same name as a function in the superclass, but with different parameters, it is considered an overload. The subclass and superclass are considered the same scope for overloading purposes.'

'Cangjie programming language_function_overload_function_overloading_restrictions': 'In Cangjie code language, Static member functions and instance member functions of classes, interfaces, and structs cannot overload each other.
Constructors, static member functions, and instance member functions of enum types cannot overload each other.
Variables and functions cannot have the same name in the same scope.'
